[b][color=white]Proxy Selling Now Allowed[/color][/b]
Since the SST subforum has now been deleted, [url=https://hackforums.net/member.php?action=profile&uid=1][b][color=#FF66FF]Omniscient[/color][/b][/url] now allows proxy selling on the forum. For those who don't know what proxy selling is, it's when an Ub3r or L33t sells for a regular or non-member. It can be an eBook, product, service, etc. - it now is allowed on Hack Forums.[i][size=x-small][url=https://hackforums.net/showthread.php?tid=5452026] >>Source[/url][/size][/i]

[b][color=white][u]Announcement Threads[/u][/color][/b]
[list]

[url=https://hackforums.net/showthread.php?tid=5452026][b]Proxy Selling Allowed[/b][/url] - [url=https://hackforums.net/member.php?action=profile&uid=1L][b][color=#FF66FF]Omniscient[/color][/b][/url]
We are notified that proxy selling is now in fact allowed after being disallowed when SST section was allowed on Hack Forums. More information can be found in the thread provided.[/list]

[b][color=white][u]Informational Threads[/u][/color][/b]
[list]

[url=https://hackforums.net/showthread.php?tid=5445415][b][Tutorial] Gambling with Blackjack[/b][/url] - [url=https://hackforums.net/member.php?action=profile&uid=1012051][b][color=#FFFFFF]Vossen[/color][/b][/url]
In this tutorial, [url=https://hackforums.net/member.php?action=profile&uid=1012051][b][color=#FFFFFF]Vossen[/color][/b][/url] guides us on the proper starting techniques to gambling with blackjack. Please note that gambling is a very risky business and more than likely not recommended by anyone.[/list]

[b][color=white][u]Entertaining Threads[/u][/color][/b]
[list]

[url=https://hackforums.net/showthread.php?tid=5454050][b]Hypothetical HF Name Change[/b][/url] - [url=https://hackforums.net/member.php?action=profile&uid=1][b][color=#FF66FF]Omniscient[/color][/b][/url]
[url=https://hackforums.net/member.php?action=profile&uid=1][b][color=#FF66FF]Omniscient[/color][/b][/url] asks all of Hack Forums users, hypothetically, what would you suggest Hack Forums domain to be changed to? We are given a poll and can discuss our votes throughout the thread.[/list]

[list]
[url=https://hackforums.net/showthread.php?tid=5455448][b]Would you sell the second half of your life for 100 million usd?[/b][/url] - [url=https://hackforums.net/member.php?action=profile&uid=2682347][b][color=#00AAFF]Caliban[/color][/b][/url]
Would you live only up to 40 years old for $100,000,000? That's a huge number and can last you the entire 40 years, but is it worth living for a short period of time and not being able to continue living past 40 for a price tag?[/list]

[b][color=white][u]Member Feedback Threads[/u][/color][/b]
[list]

No members feedback threads this week.[/list]

[b][color=white][u]Contests and Giveaways[/u][/color][/b]
[list]

[url=https://hackforums.net/showthread.php?tid=5451371][b][$4000 BTC] THE BIG CHRISTMAS GIVEAWAY <-[/b][/url] - [url=https://hackforums.net/member.php?action=profile&uid=3282602][b][color=#99FF00]fannas1[/color][/b][/url]
To celebrate The Holidays, [url=https://hackforums.net/member.php?action=profile&uid=3282602][b][color=#99FF00]fannas1[/color][/b][/url] is throwing a $4,000 BTC contest for all users of Hack Forums! [/list]

[list]
[url=https://hackforums.net/showthread.php?tid=5453300][b][Illuminati - Occult] HUGE GIVEAWAY | Upgrades, Awards, Gift Cards, and more.[/b][/url] - [url=https://hackforums.net/member.php?action=profile&uid=3280351][b][color=#FFFFFF]Bane[/color][/b][/url]
The Hack Forums official group, Illuminati, are now giving back to the community of Hack Forums by giving out a bunch of great prizes![/list]

[b][color=white][u]Miscellaneous[/u][/color][/b]
[list]

[url=https://hackforums.net/showthread.php?tid=5452414][b]HackForums tattoo[/b][/url] - [url=https://hackforums.net/member.php?action=profile&uid=3169163][b][color=#00AAFF]Wakka[/color][/b][/url]
We have quite the discussion in this thread asking all users of Hack Forums, [i]Would you get hack forums tattooed on your forehead for $50k BTC?[/i] [/list]

[align=center][img]https://hackforums.news/assets/v3/TechNews/Gladly.png[/img][/align]

[align=left]
[url=http://www.reuters.com/article/us-samsung-elec-smartphones-idUSKCN12O0GP][b]Samsung Confirms Note Line not Dead, Offers Note 8 Trade in For Note 7 Customers[/b][/url]
After a $5B recall of explosive proportions on their Galaxy Note 7 line, Samsung has decided to not jump ship on the note line just yet. Samsung has announced that they will be giving those who bought Note 7's and traded them for another Galaxy device a free upgrade when the time comes. Those who traded to another Galaxy S7 device only have to pay half of the retail price for the Note 8. Customers will be able to upgrade to a Galaxy Note 8 device when they release sometime next year.

[url=http://www.miamiherald.com/news/politics-government/election/article111832342.html][b]Florida Electric Companies Spends Millions Preventing Roof Solar Power[/b][/url]
With solar power becoming cheaper and more available to consumers every day, more and more home-owners are starting to opt for home solar power. Florida electric companies are not too happy with this however, as the electric companies are funneling money into anti-rooftop solar legislation. Amendment 1, an amendment looking to limit and slow the expansion on Florida solar, is being promoted by multiple energy companies, with companies throwing in excess a total of $30 million in campaigns to promote Amendment 1. Power & Light, Florida's biggest electric company, has even spent over $14 million in just trying to promote the amendment. If the amendment were to pass, new solar companies would have multiple barriers for entry, limiting rooftop solar's availability to Florida consumers. Some other companies promoting the limiting and misleading amendment include Duke Energy, and Tampa Electric Co.

[url=https://bgr.com/2016/10/27/macbook-pro-2016-apple-event-reveal/][b]Apple Unveils New MacBook Pro Line[/b][/url]
Long awaited by many MacBook users, Apple has announced their newest line of MacBooks this week, showing off some pretty unique new features. The most notable change seen in the 2016 MacBook line is the addition of a touch sensitive screen, placed right above the keyboard. The touch pad will feature integration to apps like Messenger, iMovie, and many others. The addition of this feature leaves some professional creatives confused, but its usefulness will be put to the test on release. Some other notable features of the MacBook line - or lack-of feature, is the removal of nearly all of the ports previously featured on the MacBook. None of the new MacBooks feature an HDMI port, SD card slot, disk drive, or even traditional USB ports. In fact, the only ports you'll find on the new MacBooks are two extremely fast USB Type-C ports, and a headphone jack (despite it's removal from the iPhone). This means that iPhone users cannot charge their iPhone 7 or use their lightning headphones on the MacBook. The newest 15" MacBook Pro is configurable with up to a quad-core Intel i7 processor, a 2TB solid-state drive, four USB-C ports, and an AMD Radeon GPU. The standard 15" MacBook will go for $2400, while the lowest end 13" MacBook will retail at $1800. Every new MacBook model is available for purchase now, but will reach customers within the next two or three weeks.
[/align]

[b][url=http://www.npr.org/2016/11/04/500728907/senators-investigate-reports-wells-fargo-punished-workers][color=#FFFFFF]Senators take on Wells Fargo[/color][/url]
[/b]Wells Fargo cannot catch a break. A handful of U.S. based senators have stepped forward. Elizabeth Warren and associates have moved to demand answers from the banking behemoth. Over the past month, there have been scores of reports made public in regards to retribution that was handed down by bank managers to lower level employees who acted out against said managers. If these lower level employees were to talk to anyone about their actions at work, bank managers would punish them. The NPR reported "In a letter to Wells Fargo's new CEO, Timothy Sloan, Warren, D-Mass., and Sens. Robert Menendez, D-N.J., and Ron Wyden, D-Ore., say the bank may have "misled regulators about the scope of the fraud." The push for additional information has come to light after dozens of Wells Fargo workers were fired or even forced to resign. The workers were punished due to reaching out to the bank’s ethics line. In turn, the ethics line took the information and turned it over to the banking managers. As soon as the banking managers found out, they fired all of those involved. Even more, the NPR noted, "They all said they were fired or pushed to resign after resisting the pressure to push products on customers that they didn't want and for reporting unethical practices in their branches to managers or the company's ethics line." Could this be the straw that breaks the camel’s back?

[b][url=http://abcnews.go.com/International/wireStory/russian-media-backs-trump-questions-us-democracy-43322294][color=#FFFFFF]Russian Media backs Trump[/color][/url]
[/b]What first started out as a joke has turned out to be nothing short of yet another Trump scandal. Russian media has taken measures to make it clear who should be the next U.S. president. As of late, Russian media has taken aim at pointing out all of the allegations that are being brought to light against Hillary Clinton. The media within Russia made it clear that all of the claims are backed with factual proof. Time and time again, Clinton has been pointed out as being not only corrupt but also rigging the election altogether. Whatever the case, journalists in Russia all agree on one thing: "Clinton has a choice. Either she gets the presidency or she goes behind bars," pro-Kremlin journalist Dmitry Kiselyov said during his flagship Sunday program on the state-controlled Vesti channel. Unlike the anti-establishment Trump, he told viewers, Clinton has the full backing of the U.S. security services, "oligarchic" corporations and the media." With this in mind, Trump has the support of the Russian media. As pointed out by the journalist, Clinton’s life relies on whether or not she gets to take the reigns as the next president of the United States. If Trump prevails, many Clinton supporters fear she will end up in the hands of the Federal Bureau of Investigation. The gold behind the curtain is Trump holds similar positions when it comes to foreign policy issues and the ongoing wars in places such as Syria and Iraq. Perhaps this will be the first time in decades that the U.S. sees eye to eye with Vladimir Putin.

[b][url=http://www.nbcnews.com/feature/missing-in-america/freed-captive-kala-brown-told-police-she-witnessed-captor-shoot-n678146][color=#FFFFFF]Kala Brown found[/color][/url]
[/b]Remember Ariel Castro? He was the serial kidnapper from Ohio that imprisoned several young girls for years. Another serial criminal and registered sex offender has now been caught. Todd Kohlhepp was taken into custody Thursday and was charged with kidnapping. For two months, Kala Brown was repeatedly raped, beaten, and tortured at the hands of Kohlhepp. After being imprisoned for two months, Brown made it known to the world that what she experienced would be life changing. On August 31st, Brown and boyfriend, David Carver ended up at Kohlhelpp's property. Upon entering, Carver was shot and instantly killed. For the next two months, Brown would be turned into Kohlhelpp's personal sex slave. Brown was found in a storage container tied down by chains that originated at both her neck and ankles. Also found on the property was the body of her boyfriend, David Carver. Police are actively investigating the issue and are expecting a murder charge to be handed down sometime early next week.
